resources.string: is to provide nutrition to students that fuels successful learning.

We provide approximately 125,000 lunch meals, 98,000 breakfast meals and 10,000 after school meals daily at over 219 school sites. In addition, during the summer we provide approximately 300,000 summer meals at Dallas ISD schools and other non-school sites. FCNS is totally self-sufficient.

 Food and Child Nutrition Services (FCNS) has its own warehouse operation that distributes 28,000 cases per week, a production kitchen that distributes 36,000 meals a week to satellite schools and technology services that manages over 800 computers.

 We have an agreement with the Texas Department of Agriculture (TDA) to operate the Child Nutrition Programs as outlined in federal and state regulations. Our current year budget is $117 million.

The Dallas Independent School District is a school district based in Dallas, Texas. Dallas ISD, which operates schools in much of Dallas County, is the second largest school district in Texas and the twelfth largest in the United States.
